places.generalDescription: Cardiff Castle, located in the heart of the city, is a captivating blend of Victorian Gothic architecture and ancient history. Built on the remnants of Norman and Roman ruins, this popular tourist attraction offers visitors a glimpse into its two millennia of history. The castle features a magnificent 12th-century keep and opulent 19th-century Gothic Revival interiors designed by renowned architect William Burges.

sources.snippet: The castle is popularly considered to be one of the most beautiful and historically important landmarks of Cardiff, and is a great place to learn about the city‚Äôs past, especially if you and your loved one are history buffs. Located in the heart of the city, the age-old castle dates back to the 11th century, before which it used to be roman fort. You can also enjoy a guided tour of the Cardiff Castle with your significant other, and learn new facts and trivia about this place, whilst also seeing attractions like the famous State Rooms here.
sources.shortName: 15 Things To Do In Cardiff For Couples For A Delightful Holiday!

sources.snippet: There are many places across the globe that bill themselves as ‚Äúhidden gems,‚Äù but the rooftop garden at Cardiff Castle truly does have a claim to this descriptor. While the castle itself is frequently visited, the rooftop garden is not as popular, which is a shame, considering its beauty. A visit to this romantic place in Cardiff provides the opportunity to admire stunning painted tiles in a variety of vibrant colours, as well as a range of water fountains‚Äîan absolute delight of an experience that can make for the perfect romantic day out.

sources.snippet: Built atop a nearly 2,000-year-old Roman fortification, Cardiff Castle is one of the most visited tourist attractions in all of Wales. It's also one of the most romantic and best preserved of the country's many historic castles, with some of the oldest sections dating back as far as the 10th century. One of the most notable features that make it such an attractive place to visit are the State Apartments.

reviews.text: It's great to step back in time in this castle. Getting up to the top of the tower was challenging, with lots of steps, and once in there, there's more steep steps to climb but we loved it!..the grounds has a garden chess set,which my grandson really enjoyed playing a game. Was in and around the place in about 2hrs. Would recommend if you like your history,that's for sure..

Nice experience. Very lovely staffs. Inside is quite spacious like a mini park. Totally enjoyed the time. Guided tour is available for certain restricted part of the castle. Got a very nice panoramic view of the city from the tower. Highly recommend climbing it. Stairs are quite steep though. Gotta be careful. A very interesting stall named 'Fund your name in the history or something' was there. Kids love that stall. Overall highly recommended.

A really brilliant experience here. Make sure you download the audio guide and bring your earphones. One thing I would have preferred is that their locations and different numbers so you would know what to listen to add particular spots. But it's great to see so many languages catered for and despite it being busy, it was a really peaceful and enjoyable atmosphere. Definitely a highlight on my trip to Cardiff.

places.name: Wales Millennium Centre

reviews.text: We went here yesterday (Saturday) to watch The Book of Mormon. It was our very first visit and we thoroughly enjoyed the experience. It was easily accessible by train and bus and very well placed. Excellent architectural design and detail, professional, welcoming, friendly and knowledgeable staff, amazing theatre auditorium. Available spaces for eating and drinking and lounges during intermission. Don't forget to check out the theatre gift shoppe for some interesting items. If not busy, the helpful staff can tell you more about the theatre and give you info about their theatre tour offerings. Tips: the ground floor toilets could get very crowded with long queues so try to get there early enough. If you need temporary storage for your bags/luggage, there's  a Premier Inn just across the road (via the Stasher app). Hot drinks not allowed inside the theatre for safety reasons. If you need a quick charge your phone, there is a table in the dining area near area A with sockets.

Perhaps this is a tad unfair but I was only allowed into the front of the Centre, or was it the centre of the front? All doors to where the punters sit to watch performances were locked. I asked a member of staff if I could have a look but he refused. I joked that what I'd seen so far was so good it could've been built in England. Lead balloon time. Lighten up little Welsh man, okay, you weren't amused but a deafening silence would've been better than the response you gave. Coming over the border? Don't. We'll sing you away. Keep a welcome in the hillside, keep a welcome in the Vales, I may be back one day.

**The Wales Millennium Centre: A World-Class Cultural Destination**

The Wales Millennium Centre stands as one of Cardiff's most impressive architectural achievements, and after experiencing "The Book of Mormon" there, I can confidently say it lives up to its reputation as a premier cultural venue.

The building itself is breathtaking from the moment you approach. The distinctive design creates an immediate sense of anticipation, and the location in Cardiff Bay couldn't be more perfect. The waterfront setting adds to the overall experience, making a visit feel like a special occasion.

What truly sets this venue apart is the theatre itself. The comfort level is exceptional - genuinely the most comfortable live theatre experience I've encountered. The seating is thoughtfully designed, allowing you to focus entirely on the performance without any distractions from cramped conditions or poor sightlines.

The technical aspects are flawless. Both the acoustics and visibility are outstanding, ensuring every seat in the house offers an excellent experience. During "The Book of Mormon," every word was crystal clear and every visual detail was perfectly visible, which is exactly what you want from a musical production.

Even the gift shop deserves recognition. Rather than the typical tourist fare, they offer unique and lovely items that feel special. The staff were genuinely friendly and helpful, adding to the overall positive experience.

The Wales Millennium Centre delivers on every level - from its stunning architecture and prime location to its superior comfort and technical excellence. It's a venue that enhances any performance, making it a true cultural jewel in Cardiff Bay. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a top-tier theatre experience.

places.generalDescription: National Museum Cardiff is a grand setting that houses archaeological artefacts, art, and natural history exhibits. Visitors can also enjoy temporary exhibitions. The museum boasts the largest collection of Impressionist paintings outside of Paris, featuring works by renowned artists like Renoir, Monet, and Pissarro. Additionally, visitors can explore the city's diverse influences and cultures at Cardiff Castle, which dates back to 55 AD and showcases Roman and Norman architecture.

sources.snippet: Ranked as one of the most popular things to do in Cardiff for couples is visiting the National Museum Cardiff to admire its vast and impressive collection of art. The National Museum is home to some of the best art collections in all of Europe, and offers you a chance to admire at five hundred years‚Äô worth of masterpieces of art, from paintings and drawings, to sculptures, silverware as well as ceramics from Wales and the rest of the world. It is here where you and your partner can spend some time marvelling at the most impressive works of Modern and Impressionist Art, Historic Art as well as Applied Art

places.name: National Museum Cardiff

reviews.text: Visited recently for my birthday and was quite surprised at the variety of exhibitions. There was a lot to see about the history of the earth, history of Cardiff and evolution. For the art lovers, the museum also offers a good art collection. There is a souvenir shop, and a cafe if you wanted to grab something. In all, I think i spent over 2 hours going through everything. Admission is free, but do remember to make a nice donation in the boxes all over the museum

Amazing museum hands down! Very well maintained space and exhibits. The collection pieces are displayed logically and beautifully. The 1900 - contemporary ceramics collection itself is a great reason enough to visit the museum.

So many other current exhibitions running when I was there and they are all great! Very inspiring for everyone visiting.

5th August 2025
This was my first visit to the Cardiff Museum, I took my Canadian cousin's family. We thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The layout was simple and easy to follow, every exhibit was marked with a brief description & history.

What I loved most of all was how child friendly Cardiff Museum is. There were a number of stools for children to sit down, view and take notes if they preferred. In some displays there were artifacts  like hats, caps, puzzles, etc that the children could use and have fun.

A really good place to visit and it's free to enter.

The historic structure features a soaring glass roof and exudes a friendly atmosphere. In addition to exploring the market, visitors can also enjoy nearby attractions like the National Museum Cardiff and indulge in street food at Cardiff Indoor Market.

reviews.text: fantastic spot to explore, offering a variety of fresh produce, local goods, and unique finds. The atmosphere is vibrant, and it's a great place to support independent traders. I came early, so many of the shops weren't open yet, but it was still a pleasant visit. Definitely a must-visit if you're in Cardiff and looking for something local and authentic!

You can find a variety of stalls there: foods, books, bags, souvenirs, fish‚Ä¶ I tried Welsh cakes from a stall run by very sweet ladies. They were delicious!
Also, I realized I forgot to bring my lock, and I found one there and bought it. Imagine how diverse the market is. üòÖ

Love the great food options here and the decent attempt at gentrifying a very cool old building & market. It sadly is still rather filthy and is still a little short of the mark compared to some other (foodie) markets around Europe.

That being said, I'd come back thanks to the delicious food (kudos to the Neapolitan pizza, Greek gyros and Welshcakes). If they cleaned this place up a bit it'd be 5-star level.

places.generalDescription: Bute Park, located in the heart of Cardiff, is a sprawling riverside beauty spot that offers a mix of historic features and modern amenities. The park boasts an arboretum with 41 Champion trees, as well as Victorian gardens and friary ruins. Recent restoration efforts have enhanced the park with new facilities such as the Bute Park Education Centre, three cafes, woodland balance trail, sculpture trail, fitness trail, and a diverse events program.

sources.snippet: Bute Park is centrally located in Cardiff behind Cardiff Castle, and is not only a lovely green space for strolling, picnicking, and riding a bike but it's a great thoroughfare to cut through for getting from one section of the city to another. This park is one of the largest urban parks in the country, and it has a beautiful mix of unique trees, flowers, walking paths, woodlands, sculptures, fitness stations, and play trails for children. The landscape includes an arboretum that features notable species of trees known as champion trees that are either the widest or tallest of their species within the UK.

They show 12 exhibitions, 2000 cinema screenings, 600 theatre performances alongside workshops, classes, talks, and events throughout the year.

places.name: Chapter Arts Centre

reviews.text:
Polite and helpful staff at reception, they have a selection of board games and a community pantry if I recall correctly. Such a nice place to have locally.

Lovely selection of food and drink throughout the day and a calm environment when I visited. Had their flat white and their passion and coconut cake. Moist and fruity cake. Absolutely no notes. Delicious.

Coffee was much nicer than the stuff you get at a big coffee chain spot thanks to them using Hard Line Coffee, a local roaster, as their bean supplier.

I will be sure to come back to try the cinema soon :)

Very underused in comparison to it's past. Chapter is a great place to meet and move on. It is also very good for parents with kids during the day. The toilets are clean. The bar is traditionaly slow for service. Coffee purchase wait time is lenghty, can take 10 mins to get back to your company. The Cinemas have an excellent selection of programming dealt with by the front desk team and the food looks nice. Study rooms and private room hire available. Table Top Gaming afternoons etc...

Went to the cinema here and had a drink in the lovely sunny courtyard. The cinema was very impressive and not too hot inside. The seats were very plush but a little bit tight on the hips, leg room was fairly good. I really enjoyed this cinema, highly recommended.

places.address: Market Rd, Cardiff, CF5 1QE, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Cardiff, Pasture Restaurant is a chic destination that promises an unforgettable dining experience. This stylish steakhouse, which opened its doors in 2020, showcases an impressive open kitchen where charcoal grills and dry-aging cabinets take center stage. Here, the art of fire-based cooking shines as they prepare mouthwatering steaks over coal and cherry wood for that extra burst of flavor.

sources.snippet: Set next to Cardiff Castle, this grand steakhouse features an open kitchen where you can see the chefs at work and dry ageing cabinets displaying whole cuts of beef. Whilst the focus is superb sharing steaks cooked over charcoal, their sides and starters don‚Äôt let the side down, from short rib croquettes with gochujang aioli to four cheese mac & cheese with bacon crumb. Sample dish: Has to be the awesome-looking (and tasting) Tomahawk, served on the bone
sources.shortName: Cardiff's 55 best restaurants 2025: The best places to eat in the city

sources.snippet: This was the first-ever restaurant we went to as a couple in Cardiff (below), and it shouldn‚Äôt be missed. Pasture is set up to be a showcase, with an open kitchen and dry ageing cabinets which show cuts of beer that are being aged ready to be cut into their signature steaks. Their steaks are aged for a minimum of 35 days, and they have a selection of ribeyes all the way to 1kg Tomahawks & Porterhouse to share.
sources.shortName: Fun Things To Do In Cardiff for Couples: A Complete Guide

places.name: Pasture Restaurant Cardiff

reviews.text:
We went for dinner two days ago after a friend recommended us, and had one of the best steak experiences.

Our server Lin was amazing, very welcoming and went out of her way to introduce the menu to us.

For starters, we had the Smoked Beef Carpaccio. It arrived with smoke on top, which added to the beautiful presentation and flavour, tasting like a burst of umami. We also had the Kohlrabi Som Tam as a side, which was refreshing, contrasting the rich meaty flavours of the steak and porkchop.

For meats, we had a 200g Sirloin and a Porkchop. Both meats were dry-aged, the sirloin being beautifully seared with a nice crust, the inside being perfectly pink. Every bite was tender and juicy, and I was able to feel the charcoal flavour. We didn't use the garlic butter (one of the few sauces provided on the menu) as our steak philosophy is that a good steak doesn't need sauce to bring out flavour.

The porkchop was brilliant alongside the steak, with a sweet brown sauce that was rich in flavour. The cherry on top was the pork rinds, perfectly accompanying the bold flavours of the porkchop.

Alongside the delightful meal was a cozy atmosphere, and I think the window in the dry aging rack was an interesting feature, the customers being able to view meats being dry-aged in real life.

Overall, the meal was delicious and the service from Lin was amazing, one of the best restaurants in Cardiff!

What an amazing place. Loved the concept of steak and music. It is quite loud but very enjoyable. The steaks were just fantastic. Perfectly dry aged with intense beef flavor. Very obviously high quality beef. We went for a 700g chateaubriand which was just perfect for two. There is a very solid kids menu. The staff is also fabulous and very friendly.

They also got us some brownies and a candle for my birthday which was really sweet.

An excellent restaurant! The service is of a very high standard ‚Äì friendly and polite from the moment you walk in. The food‚Ä¶ wow! We haven't had anything this delicious before! Plus, a surprise from the restaurant for our anniversary ‚Äì such a lovely gesture. We highly recommend it! Definitely worth a visit.‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

places.generalDescription: Treetop Adventure Golf is a vibrant mini-golf experience nestled in the heart of Cardiff, perfect for everyone from kids to university students. If you're looking for an alternative to traditional date nights, this jungle-themed venue offers a fun escape with tropical cocktails and delicious bites. Located within the bustling St David's Shopping Centre, it features two exciting 18-hole courses‚ÄîAncient Explorer and Tropical Trail‚Äîwhere you can navigate through lush greenery reminiscent of a South American rainforest.

sources.snippet: This mini golf adventure is largely loved by most young people in Cardiff, right from small children to university students. If you cheesy date nights holding hands and romance is not yours or your date‚Äôs cup of tea, then this definitely is your place. You can enjoy the tropical cocktails and jungle grubs or show off your skills by cracking the tropical trail and navigating through the rainforest and impress your date.
sources.shortName: Undistanced dating: Top seven places to go on a date in Cardiff.

sources.snippet: Price: ¬£10.25 per person for 18 holes (¬£8.75 for students) and ¬£15 for 36 holes (¬£12.50 for students). Looking for some adventure?. Then look no further than Treetop Adventure Golf, one of my favourite indoor activities in Cardiff, which is situated in the St Davids Centre.

places.name: Treetop Golf Cardiff

reviews.text: This is a relaxing place to spend quality time with family or friends while having fun. The environment is clean and well-maintained, and they provide locks for the safe keeping of your belongings. The staff is friendly and welcoming, contributing to an enjoyable experience.

Really fun course, interactive holes and cool aesthetics. Wasn't expensive either for 18 holes, definitely recommend. Only thing this place needs is a tee off mat at the start of each hole but that's it.

My friends and I visited Sunday evening and had a fabulous time. The golf course is well designed, challenging but doable and fun.

We tried the new festive menu and had pizzas and cocktails. All were superb and the prices are a real bargain. We'll def be back to try the rest.

The staff were super friendly and helpful, thank you so so much for having us!

places.generalDescription: Llandaff Cathedral, located in Cardiff, is a medieval place of worship with a rich history dating back to the 10th century. The cathedral features a 10th-century Celtic cross and a triptych painted by D.G. Rossetti. Built in the 1300s on the ruins of an earlier structure, it boasts an impressive 15th-century tower and an exquisite fully-restored 18th-century Italian temple with rare religious sculptures and artifacts.

sources.snippet: Perhaps the best-known of Cardiff's many pretty churches ‚Äî and certainly one worth visiting ‚Äî the attractive Llandaff Cathedral was built in the 1300s on the ruins of the original structure built some 200 years earlier. It's a delight to tour, rewarding the adventurous traveler with a pleasant look at a landmark that has drawn worshippers from across the country since the times of Bishop Urban, the cathedral's founder. Exterior highlights include the impressive 15th-century tower, while a tour of the interior ‚Äî either self-guided or arranged through church staff ‚Äî will expose you to such features as an exquisite and fully-restored 18th-century Italian temple, notable for its rare religious sculptures and artifacts.
sources.shortName: Tourist Attractions & Places to Visit in Cardiff

sources.snippet: As you visit the cathedral with your partner, you can soak in the tranquil ambience of this cathedral and its surroundings, whilst also marvelling at the grand, age-old interiors of this stunning monument. This Anglican Parish church and cathedral has been dedicated to three famous Welsh saints, namely Dubricius, Teilo, and Oudeceus, in addition to St. Paul and St. Peter. During your visit, make sure to admire the major highlights of this monument, such as the 15th century tower, an 18th century Italian temple as well as the artefacts housed here.
sources.shortName: 15 Things To Do In Cardiff For Couples For A Delightful Holiday!

sources.snippet: Cardiff is a peaceful city wherein you won‚Äôt have to search hard just to spend some quiet time. If you wish to take your loved one on a more reflective romantic outing, pay a visit to Llandaff Cathedral. This Anglican parish church and cathedral is dedicated to Dubricius, Teilo, and Oudoceus, who are Welsh saints, as well as Saint Paul and Saint Peter.
sources.shortName: 17 Best Romantic Things To Do In Cardiff, Wales

places.name: Llandaff Cathedral

reviews.text: Beautiful Cathedral. Very well maintained. Free to enter. Allowed to take pictures so long as it is not during services due to data protection. Little shop inside. You can also light a candle. Free parking nearby. Unfortunately, I could not see a wheelchair/pram accessible entrance.

We loved visiting this cathedral! It had a chapel dedicated to the Royal Regiment of Wales/ Welsh regiment formed in 1969 and this is the regiment my husband served in. It costs ¬£1500 per day to keep the cathedral running so they do ask for donations and we certainly contributed. It is a beautiful cathedral and worth visiting. Sadly people have vandalized many of the marble effigies. The stained glass windows are beautiful. The organ immense. The cathedral has several small chapels in it including the RRW chapel and the Mary Chapel. Visit and support this wonderful cathedral and piece of Welsh history! A short walk from the cathedral are wonderful hiking trails.

This place was peaceful and we didn't expect the church to be closed for a couple of hours due to filming a Netflix show.

We kept asking the "so-called" door guard who it was filming,  but he wouldn't tell us.

However,  when we went into the church, we saw some of the production equipment and saw the title of the show.

It was a Netflix show series called Has Fallen.

Yep,  I swear if I saw Gerard Butler come out of that church, I would have fainted.   I didn't see anyone... argh!!!

We also caught the organist practicing.

places.address: Cathedral Cl, Cardiff, CF5 2LA, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Chance & Counters - Board Game Caf√© is a cozy spot near Cardiff Castle that offers over 650 board games, including classics like Dungeons & Dragons and Guess Who?. The caf√© features a diverse menu with labeled vegan options, such as sweet potato falafel ciabatta stack and Thai green vegetable curry. With quirky cocktails and a welcoming atmosphere, it's the perfect place to spend time with friends or even bring your pup along for some fun.

sources.snippet: If you prefer testing your competitiveness in a slightly more casual environment, you‚Äôll enjoy Chance and Counters, located just a short walk from Cardiff Castle. Open seven days a week, this late-night board games caf√© has over 650+ games for you to choose from, including classics like Dungeons & Dragons, Guess Who?. , Draughts and Trivial Pursuit.
sources.shortName: Things to do for adults on a night out in Cardiff

sources.snippet: If you like the sound of healthy competition but would prefer to use your brain instead of doing something active, then look no further than Chance & Counters. Chance & Counters is a super fun bar on the high street that makes for one of the best date ideas in Cardiff. This particular bar is themed around board games ‚Äì how fun is that?
sources.shortName: Date Ideas Cardiff: 25 Romantic Things to Do in Cardiff [2024]

places.name: Chance & Counters - Board Game Caf√©

reviews.text: It's absolutely amazing. Staff were so helpful and welcoming. Good space upstairs for groups. The food was great. Amazing vegan/ plant based selection. Loads of games to choose from. Staff are super helpful finding games you will love.

The food is really good, but it is pricey though. So I tend not to come for food, I just got a hot chocolate and vegan milkshake, with the cost of reserving the tables for a few hours that cost me over ¬£20. If you are happy spending a lot on food while trying some new games out before you invest it is a nice place to come occasionally.

They do also do table service which if you've got a big group is inevitably tricky mathing at the end when everyone orders different bits over several hours. So you might prefer to pay for what you order when you do at the bar to save the faff later.

It is dog friendly though, so if you have a four legged friend that is good and the tables are really roomy underneath so they'll have plenty of space to settle out of the way.

Great for games, but maybe not for stags!

We visited Chance & Counter with a group of 10 friends for a stag do, and while we had a good time, it wasn't quite fit for a large and potentially boisterous groups. The cafe is clearly geared towards board game enthusiasts who appreciate a quieter atmosphere, which is understandable. However, it also serves food and drinks, which can create a bit of a conflict when a larger group like ours is added to the mix.

Despite this, we had a great time exploring their huge selection of board games. There was something for everyone, with games of all types and durations. The food and drinks were also a hit, especially the dirty shakes (milkshakes with alcohol). They were so good I had two! Although, at ¬£12 each, they were a bit pricey. I guess the cost helps to cover the board games, but it's something to keep in mind.

The staff were great, despite having to ask us to keep the noise down several times and clearly a little distressed at time, they didn't really show it.

Helpful hints and tips:
‚Ä¢	If you're with a larger group, especially a stag or hen party, it might be worth calling ahead to see if they can accommodate you in a more secluded area.
‚Ä¢	Be prepared to pay a bit more for the food and drinks, but consider it an investment in the entertainment.
‚Ä¢	Take your time to browse the game selection - there are some real gems to discover!

places.generalDescription: The New Theatre, located in Cardiff, is a Victorian variety theatre that hosts a wide range of entertainment including short-run dramas, musicals, and plays. Situated on the corner of Park Place, it has been a prominent venue in Cardiff for many years. The theater has showcased everything from Shakespeare plays to performances by iconic figures like Sarah Bernhardt and Laurel and Hardy. It continues to be a popular destination for those seeking classy theater experiences in the Welsh capital.

sources.snippet: Ranked amongst the most things to do in Cardiff for couples is watching different shows at the New Theatre. With stunning interiors and an intimate ambience, the theatre is a great place to be if you and your partner wish to experience something cultural. Located in the heart of the city since 1906, the New Theatre also lets you enjoy some of the biggest and most famous touring productions, including that of ballet.
sources.shortName: 15 Things To Do In Cardiff For Couples For A Delightful Holiday!

sources.snippet: For those who love live music, stand-up comedy, or theatre, New Theatreon Park Place is a great spot for a romantic evening date. Think Mamma Mia and the Bowie Experience and you‚Äôre on the right lines. With a myriad of things on at any one time, you‚Äôre sure to find something to suit the vibe of your date.
sources.shortName: Date Ideas Cardiff: 25 Romantic Things to Do in Cardiff [2024]

sources.snippet: Despite its name, the New Theatre in Cardiff is they city's oldest existing performance theatre. This Edwardian masterpiece is a beautiful venue where you can spend an evening taking in a show. Performances range from musicals and comedy to live music and guest speakers.
sources.shortName: Tourist Attractions & Places to Visit in Cardiff

sources.snippet: Attending a show together at New Theatre is another one of the best most romantic things to do in Cardiff. You can see a variety of shows here. For example, you can see ballet performances, attend a concert, or see live theater!

places.name: New Theatre

reviews.text: First visit for a comedy show. What an awesome, OG venue! Bar area gets a bit cramped before the show starts, but I kinda liked that, meant mingling and chatting to the other patrons. Seats are comfy, the view was great, and you just kinda soak up that vintage theatre atmosphere. If you haven't seen a show there you should!

Went to see Karen and Gorka from strictly come dancing in speakeasy. The show was fantastic.
The theatre is a typical old fashioned theatre which is really appealing.
Comfortable seats with plenty of leg room.
Only problem for me was the stalls didn't slope and I had a tall man sat in front of me who blocked my view.

First time attending, I was extremely nervous as I had no idea where I was or where to go, the staff were amazing, lady at the door told me and my sister where to go and where everything was, very polite and professional, she gave us a book with a list of all the shows, I was pleasantly surprised of the acts they have there

The reception area was quite small ish, then theres was a small bar to get refreshments etc, and some stools and a long thin table against a wall.

The show was amazing! My sister immediately brought more tickets to come back as we had much a great time.

places.address: Park Pl, Cardiff, CF10 3LN, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Flight Club Cardiff is a new addition to the city's scene, featuring a stunning rooftop terrace with unique attractions like vintage circus caravans and classic red phone boxes. The terrace is equipped with heating, making it an all-year-round destination. On Thursdays to Sundays, visitors can enjoy the Brunch Social event offering bottomless pizza and Prosecco. This retro fairground-themed venue offers a modern take on darts and serves delicious pizzas and drinks.

sources.snippet: Another recent addition to St Mary Street is Flight Club: the darts venue that offers three floors of bars and boards. If you‚Äôve always fancied yourself as a bit of Gerwyn Price or Richie Burnett, here‚Äôs your chance to test out your skills. As well as the many dart boards dotted around the venue, there‚Äôs also a heated roof terrace ‚Äì perfect for a good catch up with your mates.
sources.shortName: Things to do for adults on a night out in Cardiff

sources.snippet: Price: ¬£10 per person for 60 minutes, or ¬£13 per person for 90 minutes. Flight Club has shot up in popularity across the nation, and Cardiff is no exception to that rule. This cool bar brings darts away from the pubs and into a sleeker environment, making it feel a little more upmarket and date-friendly.
sources.shortName: Date Ideas Cardiff: 25 Romantic Things to Do in Cardiff [2024]

sources.snippet: Flight Club isn't just a seriously cool bar, themed after vintage fairgrounds and boasting plenty of intimate nooks - it's also the home of social darts. Bring out your competitive spirit with a couple of games, accompanied by cocktails and pizza paddles.
sources.shortName: Fun Things To Do In Cardiff For Couples

sources.snippet: From here, you could explore the National Museum Cardiff, try street food at Cardiff Indoor Market, shop in the historic arcades, play games in NQ64, Golf Fang or Flight Club, or have a bottomless brunch in a cocktail bar or one of the rooftop bars.
sources.shortName: Date Night Ideas in Cardiff Bay
Celebrate Valentine‚Äôs Day in Cardiff

places.name: Flight Club Cardiff

reviews.text: I've been a few times the last few years and always had a great time. This time we did pizza and Prosecco. When we first arrived we noticed we were 2 bottles short but staff quickly rectified this and were more than helpful. Busy and lovely, always a good day/night here.

Great cosy fun bar in the city centre. I was a bit apprehensive about the concept of darts and bar but my reservations were unfounded. It's a great place to relax and chill with friends whilst playing darts and drinking and eating. You're greeted by a host who will explain the process and you're allocated a spacious area for you to play. It's not the usual darts rules as there are multiple playing modes to choose from. By pressing a button there is a table service where someone will take your order - there is a service charge when paying the bill. We had a good pizza and soft drinks, which I feel isn't indicative of the quality of the food. When our playing time ended we were offered a free extra 15 minutes which we declined as we didn't have enough time. Shoutout to Randal the host, smiley, polite and did a great job explaining everything to us and giving us a warm welcome! A real credit to the team. Overall a great place to chill with friends whilst relaxing over games of darts.

I've visited flight club twice, once with a group of friends and once for a works Christmas night out. Thoroughly enjoyed both times!
After going the first time I knew it would be a great option for the Christmas do, and it was such a good laugh, we played over two boards, next to each other meaning you can still socialise with everyone.
You can order drinks to the area but the bar was close by too.
After we finished our session we went out to the rooftop area which was great, plenty of space and a great atmosphere. Although you're outside there are plenty of heat lamps to keep you warm no matter the temperature.

places.address: 3-4 St Mary St, Cardiff, CF10 1AT, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Castle Quarter Arcades, located just a short stroll from Cardiff Castle, is a charming historical shopping district established in 1885. Comprising three arcades - Castle Arcade, High Street Arcade, and Duke Street Arcade - this Victorian and Edwardian architectural gem houses over 80 independent specialty shops. Visitors can explore an array of unique outlets including drapery shops, apothecaries, tailors, jewelers, and fortunetellers.

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre looking for the ultimate shopping experience in Wales, in order to pick up a gift for that special someone, then Castle Quarter Arcades will always exceed your expectations. The arcade, which occupies two storeys and dates back to the 19th century, is home to a wide range of stores that sell organic produce, jewellery, fashion, and much more. Besides shopping to your heart‚Äôs content, you‚Äôll also be able to admire the stunning architecture that has helped Castle Quarter Arcades stand the test of time.
sources.shortName: 17 Best Romantic Things To Do In Cardiff, Wales

sources.snippet: Then, you should definitely check out the Castle Quarter Arcades together. You can find 3 covered passages here with lovely shops. And you can find the golf course next to a historic castle, which makes this place even more special!
sources.shortName: 41 Date Ideas in Cardiff: Romantic Things To Do in Cardiff

sources.snippet: Visiting the arcades in Cardiff is a nostalgic and fun date night idea. Whether you‚Äôre into classic arcade games or modern video games, you‚Äôll find something to enjoy. Plus, a bit of friendly competition never hurts!
sources.shortName: Date Night Ideas in Cardiff for Engaged Couples

places.name: Castle Quarter Arcades

reviews.text: The Arcades all over Cardiff are really beautiful to walk around. A lot of them have alfresco dining with candles (very rare to see in the UK!) and wide variety of places to sit in for coffee or food. Some very nice shops as well.

Discovered this gem just before Christmas.  Retro. Lively. Nicest coffee at the deli. Haberdashery. Cobblers. Jewellery merchants. Every nationality of cuisine known to man, including the pinnacle of Welsh culinary delight, The Welsh Cake. Always long queues, well worth the wait. Crowning glory is Kelly's record store on the upper level. All the shopkeepers were busy, but all took time to chat. The building itself is beautiful in an industrial, steampunk kind of way. Go. Spend the afternoon. Love it.

Walking around the Castle Quarter Arcades felt so authentic. Like a little time travel moment. The Victorian style all around was amazing, and it really adds something special to the whole Cardiff experience.

places.address: Castle St, Cardiff, CF10 1BU, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the vibrant Olympic Village, Vindico Arena is a premier indoor venue that caters to all ice skating enthusiasts. Whether you're looking to take lessons from skilled instructors or enjoy a leisurely public skating session, this arena offers an enchanting experience perfect for couples seeking a romantic outing in Cardiff. The convenient transport links make it easy to reach by bus, taxi, or car. For those craving adventure, Vindico Arena also serves as the home ground for the Cardiff Devils hockey team.

sources.snippet: Situated in the Olympic village, Vindico Arena is home to all things ice skating, making it one of the most romantic date ideas in Cardiff. Great transport connections to the village mean it‚Äôs easy to get there by bus, taxi, or car. Book a lesson with a professional instructor or go during public times, and wobble it out together on the ice.
sources.shortName: Date Ideas Cardiff: 25 Romantic Things to Do in Cardiff [2024]

sources.snippet: For those who like to get active, how about one of these adrenalin-fuelled urban adventures in Cardiff, including kayaking at Cardiff International White Water or taking a cool turn on the ice at Vindico Arena.
sources.shortName: Places to visit in Wales for couples

sources.snippet: The Vindico Arena host public skates daily, and regularly offer beginner ‚Äòlearn to skate‚Äô sessions. Why not test your date‚Äôs skills and find out if they‚Äôre as graceful as a gazelle or look a bit Bambi-on-ice.
sources.shortName: Cardiff Date Ideas ‚Ä¢ The best places for your date night in Cardiff

places.name: Vindico Arena

reviews.text: We went to watch the Devils play .. first time gif my husband to watch an ice hockey game .. the Devils didn't disappoint with a great win! The arena is easy to get to and the staff make your experience a positive one, being extremely kind and helpful.

First time coming here to watch Cardiff Fire ice hockey team. Was a great time watching them, but feel food and drink is overpriced! From attending other sporting events, I'd say prices are abit more than normal.

This is a fantastic night out. And watching the Cardiff Devils. Is a fantastic experience for anybody. Even if you've never watched ice hockey before definitely worth going to the venue and taking in the whole experience.

places.address: Olympian Dr, Cardiff, CF11 0JS, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the vibrant streets of Cardiff, The Dead Canary is a hidden gem that defies its name. This unique cocktail bar boasts a 1920s-inspired design and offers an array of meticulously crafted cocktails with artistic flavor combinations. The intimate, dimly lit ambiance sets the stage for an unforgettable evening of conversation and indulgence. Despite its quirky name, this award-winning establishment has garnered acclaim for its exceptional mixology inspired by Welsh poet Dylan Thomas' 'Death and Entrances.'

sources.snippet: Fronting innovative signature sips, atmospheric live music and low lighting, there's a reason why The Dead Canary is one of the most sought-after haunts in the city. If you're looking to romance the heck out of your beau, this killer hideout is sure to hit the spot with creatively named tipples like the Corgi Riding Fairies, made using gin and orange liqueur.
sources.shortName: Fun Things To Do In Cardiff For Couples

sources.snippet: If so, you should most definitely track down The Dead Canary. The cocktails are both strong and exquisitely made. Good luck finding the bar though, it is deliberately hard to find...we will give you a clue, it is located on Barrack Lane.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Things for Couples to do in Cardiff

places.name: The Dead Canary

reviews.text: I absolutely love dead canary. It's one of the best cocktail bars in Cardiff and for sure worth a visits. They offer a unique menu of cocktails to choose from in an amazing relaxed setting. The bartenders are also very friendly and willing to make a classic cocktail or get creative and make something else that suits your taste that isn't on the menu. I have not tried the food here yet but if the drinks are anything to go by I'm sure it's fantastic.

A fantastic experience here, staff were great, the cocktails were exceptional, never seen anything like them before! We spent far to much time and money here, didn't want to leave. Highly recommended, if you can find it...

To find the dead canary... to pressing the buzzer and eagerly waiting outside... to entering into the bar through the dark corridor... all just such fun!!!
We had a great time cosying up into the chairs after being seated. The decor is like one of your Great Aunts living rooms... full of nick nacks... leading you to be able to stare into the room for hours and find something new to gaze over.
Absolutely loved that every cocktail was based on a true story or local folklore. Each provided a chapter in a small book, "What lurks beneath the shadows"
A truly fun and memorable experience. We hope to come back on a Saturday night when we'd think it'd be bustling amd bustling. As it was very quiet when we were there (was a Wednesday night)
Thank you so much!!!

places.generalDescription: Milkwood is a charming neighborhood cafe and restaurant situated in the stylish Pontcanna suburb of Cardiff. The restaurant offers contemporary Welsh dishes using locally sourced produce, including ingredients from suppliers like Cardiff Salad Garden and E Ashton Fishmongers. The menu features delectable options such as buttermilk fried chicken-topped waffles for brunch and Cornish cod with cauliflower for dinner.

sources.snippet: Milkwood can be found on Pontcanna Street, a swanky part of central Cardiff that lies on the very edge of the city centre. Here, on a street full of quaint  ...
sources.shortName: 15 Romantic Restaurants near Cardiff
24 cosy and romantic places to eat in Wales

places.name: Milkwood

reviews.text: Fantastic place for breakfast or lunch, great selection and tasty options. Service was very good and friendly. Food is reasonably priced and worth it, but soft drinks are a tad pricey. Would absolutely recommend and come again.

My boyfriend and I visited cardiff last week. We decided to go to Milkwood for breakfast, as we had been recommended to give it a try.
My boyfriend had the breakfast bun, and I had a full English breakfast.
The food was amazing, and the chef brought our food out to us.
We would definitely recommend it to others and when we go back to Cardiff we will be going here again.
Lovely staff, great food üëå üòã

First time visiting this place for late breakfast as we wanted to try Welsh dishes. We didn't book a table but they were very accommodating and found us a table for two. I ordered bacon, cockles and laverbread on toast and it was very good. I will definitely return and would recommend to try.

places.generalDescription: Cardiff International White Water is a thrilling water course constructed for the 2012 Olympics, offering activities like rafting and river-boarding on simulated surges. Situated in Cardiff Bay's sports village, this facility provides diverse experiences for both professionals and amateurs. The 250-meter course can be tailored to accommodate various levels of expertise, from family-friendly rafting to intense canoe or kayak adventures.

sources.snippet: Fortunately for sports enthusiasts and adventure seekers, there are plenty more fun things to do in Cardiff beyond exploring its rich history. A favorite for those into water sports, Cardiff International White Water offers a wide variety of experiences and programs for professional and amateur adventurers alike. Part of the larger sports village development in Cardiff Bay, which was constructed for the 2012 Olympics, this unique facility consists of a man-made white water environment whose 250-meter course can be adjusted to suit the experience, whether it's a gentle family rafting trip or a full-on hardcore canoe or kayak heart-stopper.

reviews.text:
If you get a chance to go here, then do it. So much fun with my three friends. Easy to find, loads of parking, clean facilities and equipment. They had everything you would need bar swimwear.
Great safety introduction and prep before the activity. The facilities were incredible.
There was plenty of time to enjoy the rapids. We weren't around 5-6 times.
The guy who took us out and looked after us was a top bloke from Australia (sadly I can't remember his name) but he was great, we had so much fun and he really got involved with our silly, immature girly nature's. He was encouraging but also respectful of individuals limitations.
Thank you so much.
Stacey

Amazing experience! We were a group of 8 split across 2 rafts for the white water rapids and everything from the start was fantastic. All the instructors were great and made it super fun and engaging.  Would definitely recommend üëåüèª

Love cardiff white water!!! Park and play for ¬£14 for 2.5 hrs is so good. Loads of other bits to do including rafting, duckies, rings and climbing. Such a good modern facility. Could not recommend more

reviews.text:
After walking around Cardiff market and heading upstairs I stumbled upon this pizza place and there was no way I was walking past without giving one a go.
I'm so glad that I did because what fantastic pizza!

The pizza was cooked to perfection and full of flavour and all of the menu was reasonably priced.

There was a long wait for the pizza to arrive and the extra topping I asked for the guy did make up a price on the spot at ¬£4 which I thought was a little much.

But overall I would recommend as it's some of the best pizza around and it was also great to see this type of place situated in Cardiff market.

Saw it was the most highly rated pizza in Cardiff. Didn't disappoint, it was genuinely the best pizza we've ever had. The dough was delicious as were the obviously quality ingredients. The soft drinks were great too - well sourced 10/10. Simple and just what we needed for a hearty lunch. Recommend 100%

This pizza is fantastic - had the pepperoni and  it was really good. The dough was really nice and both light and crisp. Great for a lunch pizza and worth every penny. Seating not the best but other than that üôèüëèüèºü§üüèºü§åüèºüëåüèº‚úåüèºü´∂üèº

The restaurant's elegant ambiance complements the exquisite menu curated by Pembrokeshire-born chef Tom Simmons. Dishes like Welsh lamb cannon with crispy lamb belly and black garlic showcase the fusion of French technique and Welsh produce.

places.name: Thomas by Tom Simmons

reviews.text: What a fabulous evening spent at this wonderful venue. Service and staff are exceptional, food is absolutely outstanding. Flavours and menu so well thought out. Cocktails moreish and so unusual. The ambience and deco so stylish and welcoming. We literally stayed all evening at the bar after dinner. 10/10 highly recommended.

We had vouchers for here, which expired in December 2024. Unfortunately I was diagnosed with cancer and was undergoing chemo, so I emailed to see if we could extend the voucher, which the restaurant said was no problem.

I then needed radio added on so had to extend the vouchers another two times, which they were more than happy to accommodate.

Once we were there (finally!) the experience was fantastic, everything from the staff, the atmosphere, the food was phenomenal.

Due to the radio my mouth is quite sensitive, the staff were more than happy to provide me with some samples of wine and whiskey to see which worked best for me.

Our first meal out since our boy was born and since I finished treatment. It was a great experience.

Visited here on a Saturday night, the place seems very hectic for what's meant to be fine dining.
We went for the ¬£85 tasting menu, a few glasses of wine each etc and the food just felt flat.
The food lacked seasoning, although the presentation was beautiful, I had to ask for Salt which you don't expect especially for that price point.
I'd been to Hiraeth a few days before and it just didn't match up to it on service, atmosphere or food quality.
I think they're out pricing themselves for the quality & atmosphere vs other comparable tasting menu places in the area.

places.generalDescription: Discover the enchanting Alexandra Gardens, a romantic spot for couples in Cardiff. This historic site boasts an array of flora, including various flowers, plants, and exotic trees. Located at Cardiff's Civic Centre on King Edward VII Avenue, these gardens have been a witness to countless stories since their establishment in 1903.

sources.snippet: Pay a visit to the spectacular Alexandra Gardens and spend some time taking a stroll with your partner here, which is one of the most romantic things to do for couples in Cardiff. It is here where you can enjoy seeing some of the most beautiful sights of cherry blossom trees, especially when you visit the gardens in the spring and early summer seasons. These historic gardens are home to a myriad of different flowers, plants and tree species, in addition to various island flower beds and exotic specimen trees

reviews.text:
Truly wonderful garden - especially when in full bloom at the start of April. Lovely war memorials as well as a water fountain surrounded with statues and pillars.
Recommend going in good weather and open to the general public :)
Beautiful gardens in Cardiff. Lovely to have an evening walk around here after dinner. Very well cared for and lots of space so you don't feel crowded

Alexandra Gardens is such a beautiful and peaceful place. We really enjoyed our time here! The flowers and trees are so well maintained, and the whole park feels calm and relaxing. It's a perfect spot to go for a walk, have a picnic, or just sit and enjoy nature. The view of the City Hall nearby makes it even more scenic. It's clean, safe, and great for families, couples, or even a quiet solo visit. If you're in Cardiff and want a nice green space to relax, Alexandra Gardens is definitely worth a visit!

The bar also serves familiar pub grub and drinks. This bustling venue, situated on Caroline Street, offers electric darts, karaoke, axe throwing, pool, shuffleboard, and plenty more. places.name: Boom Battle Bar Cardiff

reviews.text:
Visited boom battle bar Cardiff on Sunday 8th December with family. Booked in for Axe throwing, darts and shuffle board.
Went for an 12pm -3pm slots doing one activity after another.
I'd say midday day is a nice calmer time to visit and especially on a Sunday, perfect for younger family members.
We were greeted by Nick got the waivers sorted for axe throwing and straight over to that activity.
Axe throwing is great fun, Nick talked through the ways to throw, demonstrated and was a good laugh. Even though my partner split an axe handle with another axe he made light of it although on the second time he done it we were taking bets if it happened a third how much a new axe set costs.
Nick was professional and fun and a great instructor if you can request people.
On to the other activities asked if we had played before (which we had), we were left to our own devices and had great fun again.
Ordered drinks and food with a table near by. Prices as expected for these type of places and food was lovely. Great as a light snack or a few dishes to share.

We used vouchers which were bought for us last Christmas and made a great outing and would suggest the vouchers if people are stuck for present ideas.

Also just for reference I done axe throwing at 27 weeks pregnant. I emailed ahead of activities to check if this was okay and checked with midwife which is completely fine, all being feeling able enough and healthy.

We came here for my brother stag do! Kerry was absolutely brilliant catering to anything we needed without a thought! She was absolutely brilliant! We thank you for making this day very special! Emily behind the bar was also awesome and didn't complain when we ordered lots of drinks! They were both so friendly and made us feel very welcome!

We came for a bottomless brunch before a gig. We were caught in traffic on the journey from north wales and called to ask if we could move our booking to a later slot, this was accommodated for us. When we got there it was so busy and the staff were fantastic. Keegan and Chloe were the main girls serving us and in the middle of a heatwave. They were both absolutely fantastic and so quick! We had about 4 drinks each at one point. Much better than anywhere else I've ever been

places.generalDescription: Cefn Mably Farm Park is a delightful destination for animal lovers and couples seeking a unique outing in Cardiff. Nestled in the picturesque countryside, this charming farm offers an array of friendly animals to meet and interact with, including playful baby goats that are sure to steal your heart. Whether you're feeding fluffy sheep or snapping photos with horses, the experience is both fun and romantic. The park features both indoor and outdoor play areas, ensuring enjoyment regardless of the weather.

sources.snippet: Pay a visit to the Cefn Mably Farm Park, and spend some time in the company of adorable animals, which is one of the most romantic things to do for couples in Cardiff. It is at this park where you can find a myriad of farm animals, while also getting a chance to play with them, feed them and click photographs with them, with your partner. With the lush countryside surrounding the park, the ambience here is no less than perfect for a unique date.

sources.snippet: At Cefn Mably Farm Park you can find a lot of farm animals that are lovely to see with your partner. For example, you can see cute baby goats at this place, which is a lot of fun. Visiting this place is definitely one of the most romantic things to do in Cardiff if you love animals.
sources.shortName: 41 Date Ideas in Cardiff: Romantic Things To Do in Cardiff

places.name: Cefn Mably Farm Park

reviews.text:
We visited the Saturday before Easter for the first time & loved it.
We didn't arrive until 2:30 (planned arrival time) and had so much fun outside we didn't have the chance to explore inside other than to grab a coffee and cake.

In my opinion it's fairly priced, not cheap for a family with a few children but worth it. Clean & plenty to do. Lots of animals and a huge indoor play centre that looked great so you can spend the whole day to get value for money.

My little boy is almost 3 and loved it, we'll definitely be back.

The coffee and cake(s) were lovely, we also bought a few bits from the farm shop on the way out. I really appreciate local goods being sold so that was great as I didn't know there was a farm shop. I'd seen comments that the food there is expensive, but personally didn't think it was too bad when looking at the menu while getting coffee. Maybe not as cheap as some play centres but I can't comment more as we didn't buy them.
Picnics are allowed on picnic benches outside and not in the cafe area.

Also thanks to the social media team, I messaged the evening before to ask what sort of food is served as I couldn't see anything online and had an informative reply quickly even though it was out of typical office hours.

We bought tickets in advance as it was Easter weekend so thought that would be best. There were some Easter activities going on which was lovely too.

There are additional costs for the train ride and a few other things but the train was only ¬£3 per person which if you have a little one that likes trains isn't too bad. You can purchase tickets online with your entry, at the entrance and at the train station before getting on (card accepted).

On entering Cefn farm in knew i was going to enjoy, the first thing I saw was The GUINEA PIGS.. I absolutely love guinea pigs.

We started at the petting zoo, which was great, my son is now old enough to enjoy petting animals too, so that made our experience even better.
As we walked around, we fed some of the other animals, which my boy enjoyed very much.
I love how there were view points for photo opportunities.
The farm was a really good size, I felt we had a decent time and was able to go back and forth to the farm.

Softplay was great, lots to do for kids and great value, ¬£11 for the farm, softplay and playground too.
I loved this little farm, a lovely good few hours and even better with friends.

Fantastic place with great entertainment inside and outside! Great food as well, we had peperoni pizza when we went there . Very clean as well with fire places inside as well.  We will definitely come back!

places.address: Cefn Mably, Cardiff, CF3 6LP, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: The Glee Club Cardiff is a versatile entertainment venue that offers live comedy shows featuring top comedians on Thursday, Friday, and Saturday nights. Additionally, the club hosts live music events throughout the week, showcasing a variety of genres from indie to jazz to pop. Situated in Cardiff Bay, this purpose-built venue provides an intimate setting with theatre-style seating and includes a bar and restaurant. The club has become a popular destination for both local and international artists due to its decent stage and affordable prices.

sources.snippet: The Glee Club is the place to be every Thursday, Friday and Saturday night. It hosts some of the best touring comedians and, over the years, including Alan Carr, Michael McIntyre, Sarah Millican, Ross Noble, Rhod Gilbert and many more on the stage.

reviews.text: Love the Glee Club. I often come to see specific people special shows but I've also been on their general normal nights and always had a great laugh. Food is fine and comes quickly and I find it all reasonably priced. We're lucky to have it on our doorstep.

Nice size venue around 250 seats at the show I attended, not much space for you tho once seated which can be uncomfortable for your self and those beside you unfortunately. Toilets are hit and miss they didn't all work and it's a very small space to form a queue.
We ordered ice cream it came with no spoons and there was no one to get the attention of to ask for one, I was sat in the centre of a long row and I didn't want everyone to have to move to let me out for it either so that was a waste of money we had also ordered main meals chicken was fried at either high temps or fried twice it was dry and dark and the burger wasn't much better. Nothing was removed from our table even during the break I thought our table would be cleared of dishes but it wasn't.
The gentleman who checked us in was fab, polite and new the floor plan well security equally polite and on the ball.
Easy to book.  Simple to find.  Loved the tables and table service (via QR code).  Could see clearly from our seats.  We had a great üëç evening.

places.name: Curado Bar

reviews.text: Absolutely love this place, delicious tapas, the team were great & our favorite beer is on tap. Can't go wrong

The food is delicious we had a wonderful  evening trying some different wines and and pairing with some exceptional tapas. The service was 5 star providing amazing suggestions and great conversation and passion.

I had a really enjoyable meal here last Tuesday evening. We were sat upstairs and the decor is fairly low key. It's not fancy but it doesn't need to be. On the way in I noticed some bar tapas so when the menu came we started by ordering one of each of all of the meat ones and a vege one.

They were delicious and well presented. We coupled this with some beer and wine.

John, our waiter, was super friendly, helpful and knowledgable about the food and wine. Made us feel really welcome and was on hand through the meal when we wanted more.

We then ordered a round of hot and cold tapas. The standouts were the chorizo which was sooo soft. The mushrooms were also immense. Loved them. Wanted more! All the dishes were great. The calamari's was a little dry and maybe needed a dip with it but it was a small footnote.

Really enjoyed the meal and would 100% go back again.

With its plush and classic interior, it has become known for exceptional service. Located within a 15-minute walk from Cardiff Met University accommodation, it's the perfect spot for a boujee Saturday brunch. reviews.text: Had a delicious meal here with friends. Mostly attentive service although occasionally waiting to get attention , when it wasn't too busy really. I found the venue a little echoey.however. The environment was lovely.

The venue is beautifully decorated with a stunning atmosphere - definitely a lovely place to sit and relax. The food was alright, nothing exceptional but enjoyable enough. Service, however, was very slow. It felt like there was only one server handling the entire place, which made the experience a bit frustrating. Staff were doing their best, but the venue really needs more hands on deck during busy periods.

Food was absolutely delicious and the service was exceptional, Solomon our waiter went above and beyond to make my birthday meal special. We visited as a family of 5 on the 26th of July, we all had a variety of different meals which were brought out quickly and efficiently, he was very attentive and he couldn't of been more welcoming, he even gave me a birthday desert with my very own candle. His service was excellent and he really made every effort to make the day memorable. Thank you Solomon and the staff at the ivy for making my day so wonderful. Would highly recommend.

reviews.text: This Japanese restaurant is truly exceptional! The food quality is outstanding, with each dish tasting authentic and delicious. We tried several items, and every one of them impressed us. The service is quick and attentive, and the staff are incredibly warm and welcoming. The decor is beautiful, and the presentation of the food is exquisite. If you're in Cardiff, I highly recommend visiting this restaurant.

Really great sushi place in Cardiff. The fish is fresh and the quality of the rolls is definitely worth the price. Which is not unreasonable for sushi. The staff are nice and the atmosphere is calm and friendly.

Went to Yakitori1 for lunch before Book of Mormon at the Millennium Centre.

Really excellent food and service.

We had the Robata Nigiri Surf n Turf, the flamed Nigiri special, Dragon roll and Kaarage chicken noodles. All were delicious although we both felt the Surf n Turf Nigiri was nice but didn't warrant the price.

Overall paid ¬£90 for the food and two beers.

Would definitely go here again when on Cardiff Bay

This lovely independent dessert spot makes 50+ flavours of ice cream in house each week, as well as serving the tastiest crepes, waffles, freak shakes and more! We loved it here and the staff are super helpful and friendly, this is definitely going to be our new fave spot for a sweet treat!

I ordered a 2 balls ice cream with a cone, and they put it in a bowl with the cone on top... my son wasn't too happy about it it's no point to order a cone if anyway it's served in a bowl. I ordered big pancakes and I have the mini pancakes.. all it's overpriced the ice cream 5.95¬£ The pancakes were nice flavour more than 10¬£ and a sprite 2.75¬£ just 2 tables on the shop with customers
